page.title: 01WINFRITH NEWBURGH AREA
page.content: The village of Winfrith Newburgh was mentioned as Winfrode which means clear stream.Many streams still flow across the area,most join the River Frome and enter the sea at Poole Harbour.The dairy and arable farms around the village have joined together to make larger and more economical units. To the North of the A352 main road is Winfrith Heath.It is the habitat of abundant wild life but with the 20th. Century addition of the Atomic Energy Establishment.Other employment in the area is in farming,and the Naval and Army Establishments at Portland and Bovington. The Tourist Industry is also important Most people come to enjoy the beauty of the coastline but others come to visit the historic sites in this part of Dorset.
